instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
This board was liquide damage arround lvds connector and lcd cable is damage too. Now have another retina assembly to test.
On board I replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and lvds connector. Now I have 5V at L9000

Board power, mouse is on. Cannot see image with flashlight.  It is retina screen, I dont know if I can see. Cannot find scl and sda and eeprom supplay. Any idea what to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: did you check for video on external monitor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Yes, video on external is Ok.  Mouse is on. Board is workingn but something happend arround lvds area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: if you have another screen i would test with that. if still no video i would check the <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and area for the correct voltage( check while known good screen is plugged it).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
[B]On board I replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and lvds connector. Now I have 5V at L9000[/B]

 I think <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is ok as I already have 5V at L9000, but I dont know if that mean that the screen is recognized.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Hold a flashlight on the back Apple logo and check if there is an image. Voltage on pin 1 of LCD conn?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
pin 1 - 0V
No video at all

F9700 is ok

<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> - 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Bad LCD/connector/cable. Are you testing this with a 2012 LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
I got this from ebay like: Mid 2012/Early 2013 Lcd Screen Full Assembly Apple MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15" Display

Already I replaced lvds 3 days ago with MBP 13 2012 model. This is the correct lvds, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Should be ok then. Check all DP lines from LCD connector to the caps (<CAPACITOR>C9020</CAPACITOR>-28). Maybe corroded trace, bad coils, missing caps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Ok, Will check all this, but what about missing backlight too? Or first appear image and later backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Without video on the screen there wil never be backlight.
